meanings.definition: To concentrate too much on a particular subject or aspect.
meanings.sent1: She overfocusses on her studies and forgets to take breaks.
meanings.sent2: He often overfocusses on work and neglects spending time with his family.
meanings.sent3: The detective overfocusses on one suspect and misses other important clues.
meanings.sent4: Her obsession with perfection overfocusses her attention on minor details.
meanings.sent5: The artist overfocusses on the tiniest brush strokes to create a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To cause something to be too sharply defined or clear in focus.
meanings.sent1: The camera overfocusses on the background instead of the main subject.
meanings.sent2: The new glasses overfocusses the text, making it difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: The microscope overfocusses the specimen, making it appear larger than it is.
meanings.sent4: The spotlight overfocusses on the lead singer, leaving the rest of the band in shadows.
meanings.sent5: The telescope overfocusses on the moon, revealing its craters in stunning detail.
